issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: Map side aggregation is extremely slow

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.description:
When trying to run a simple aggregation query with hive.map.aggr=true, map tasks take a lot of time in Hive 0.14 as against  with hive.map.aggr=false.

e.g.
Consider the query:
{code}
INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE lineitem_tgt_agg
select alias.a0 as a0,
 alias.a2 as a1,
 alias.a1 as a2,
 alias.a3 as a3,
 alias.a4 as a4
from (
 select alias.a0 as a0,
  SUM(alias.a1) as a1,
  SUM(alias.a2) as a2,
  SUM(alias.a3) as a3,
  SUM(alias.a4) as a4
 from (
  select lineitem_sf500.l_orderkey as a0,
   CAST(lineitem_sf500.l_quantity * lineitem_sf500.l_extendedprice * (1 - lineitem_sf500.l_discount) * (1 + lineitem_sf500.l_tax) as double) as a1,
   lineitem_sf500.l_quantity as a2,
   CAST(lineitem_sf500.l_quantity * lineitem_sf500.l_extendedprice * lineitem_sf500.l_discount as double) as a3,
   CAST(lineitem_sf500.l_quantity * lineitem_sf500.l_extendedprice * lineitem_sf500.l_tax as double) as a4
  from lineitem_sf500
  ) alias
 group by alias.a0
 ) alias;
{code}
The above query was run with ~376GB of data / ~3billion records in the source.
It takes ~10 minutes with hive.map.aggr=false.
With map side aggregation set to true, the map tasks don't complete even after an hour.
fields.summary: Map Side aggregation affecting map performance

comments.body: Profiler screenshot showing GroupByOperator.processHashAggr as hotspot.
Replaced get/put call to single putIfAbsent call. But couldn't find any noticeable performance improvement.

{color:red}Overall{color}: -1 at least one tests failed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12698346/HIVE-9495.1.patch.txt

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 555 failed/errored test(s), 7540 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
{noformat}

ATTACHMENT ID: 12700340 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
I think the issue here is same as HIVE-11502.
Even here the group by was on a double port & was observed only from Hive 0.14. Behavior exactly similar to Hive-11502

[~asridhar]: the easy workaround is a cast to a string, to confirm the exact issue.

Double group-bys do not work since they are not an exact type - it's a format where two different byte[] order values tend to be treated the same.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_epsilon#Values_for_standard_hardware_floating_point_arithmetics
[~gopalv]: I tried to confirm whether this issue is a duplicate of Hive-11502 by casting it to string and don't see the performance issue with map-side aggr.
confirmed as duplicate of Hive-11502 by casting l_orderkey to string and don't see the performance issue with map-side aggr
